column3: utACK 617c459c6c56911e70855dbe139ab095f435e73e.\nMakes sense.\nIdeally we should add a test for this.
utACK d01a9682b126a5f83c7311e652e6e62f2c2e1d20\n\nThis should be backported to 0.15(.1), I think.
BTW, remove TODO comment and create an issue since it requires a significant change/discussion?
@promag I opened #11240 to expand on the issue mentioned in the TODO.
Wait, do we want to also update if the witness was malleated on its way into a block?

@TheBlueMatt I considered that issue, and decided it was more conservative (at least for now) to not do that, because:\na) You can always figure out what version of the transaction got mined if you need to (just go look it up in the block file -- ok not great if you're pruning, but in theory this is possible)\nb) It's conceivable that the mined version is invalid-to-you (ie violates policy), and

Yea, ok, more complexity than I figured, this is clearly better than nothing as-is and anything more looks like it'll take some real rewriting of our malleability handling.\nutACK d01a9682b126a5f83c7311e652e6e62f2c2e1d20 +/- outstanding nits.
